title: Mount McClung
text: Mount McClung () is a <a href="mountain">mountain</a> southeast of <a href="Mount%20Gonz%C3%A1lez">Mount González</a> in the <a href="Sarnoff%20Mountains">Sarnoff Mountains</a>, <a href="Ford%20Ranges">Ford Ranges</a>, <a href="Marie%20Byrd%20Land">Marie Byrd Land</a>, Antarctica. It was discovered and mapped by the <a href="United%20States%20Antarctic%20Service">United States Antarctic Service</a> (1939–41), and was named by the <a href="Advisory%20Committee%20on%20Antarctic%20Names">Advisory Committee on Antarctic Names</a> after Lieutenant <a href="Herbert%20C.%20McClung">Herbert C. McClung</a>, <a href="U.S.%20Navy">U.S. Navy</a>, officer in charge at <a href="Byrd%20Station">Byrd Station</a> in 1965.
